description: Taking Aspirin with Warfarin increases the risk of bleeding due to anticoagulation effects.
Ibuprofen can reduce the effectiveness of Lisinopril in lowering blood pressure.
Paracetamol and Codeine may cause mild dizziness when taken together.
Grapefruit juice increases the levels of Simvastatin, leading to muscle damage risk.
Alcohol can increase the risk of lactic acidosis when taken with Metformin.
Omeprazole may reduce the effectiveness of Clopidogrel, increasing clotting risk.
Calcium supplements can reduce Levothyroxine absorption, leading to lower effectiveness.
